div.p: A38 Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch) records, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

To proof.
Deeply regret to hear of your severe illness. Trust you will soon feel better. Suggest that this letter, as official, be sent on to the hon Secr. [Ant] [Ex.] Commi[ttee]
Antarctic Exploring Committee.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller
MS is a note in reply to a note where? from […] Gates, 23 April 1890, saying he was in hospital and passing on to M, for his information, a letter from G. S. Cooper, Under Secretary, New Zealand Colonial Secretary's Office, Wellington, to Captain Pasco, President of the Victorian Antarctic Exploration Committee, Melbourne, 9 April 1890, as follows:
I have the honour to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 11th March addressed to Sir John Hall in which you ask him to ascertain for the information of the Victorian Antarctic Exploration Committee whether the Government of New Zealand would be willing to place £1000 or more upon the next estimates in aid of the proposed exploration of the Antarctic region. In accordance with Sir John Hall's request that an answer to your inquiry might be sent direct to you I have the honour by direction of the Colonial Secretary to inform you that this Government regret they are unable to see their way to ask Parliament to vote the required subsidy.
